data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great place to grab lunch whether solo or with others. Love their apple pecan salad and the potato soup is almost as good as mine. Then top it off with their signature homemade cakes and you are done working for the day. Try it for yourself!

data.title: Worth a visit
data.text: Quick and easy small restaurant downtown.  Great sandwiches, pastas and salads.  Not your ordinary quick sandwich shop menu.  They also do catering and you can also have your event at the café after hours.  Great food and great prices!

data.title: Nothing Flashy, but a great place to eat.
data.text: Unique "sandwich shoppe" on Main Avenue in Gastonia.  Nice variety of items on the menu from traditional fare to items with a little bit a of twist to them.  Try the potato salad as a side item (but only if you like/can tolerate garlic).  A variety of flavors came through.  Staff was courteous and efficient.  Chatted with the friendly chef/owner.  Wouldn't divulge his recipe for the potato salad and I don't blame him.

data.title: Quaint lunch place
data.text: Ate lunch here a couple of times while in town with work.  The menu is simple, adequate and food items are good.  Definitely worth a visit.  A great local quick service restaurant that is an attractive alternative to junk fast food.

data.title: Driving past on 85
data.text: Quick and easy from 85.  Cute little storefront cafe.  Right downtown. Cool art on the walls. Old spools used for tables.  Friendly service. Ordered Turkey Blt. Not a good quality turkey.  Very little bacon. Not worth the price. You order at a counter and they bring it to your table. Ordered a cup of loaded potato soup. It was scorched.  Had a burnt flavor.  My wife ordered the steak sandwich melt.  It was pretty good. She had the cup of tomato basil soup. It was average.  We got two ice teas.  Free refills on tea if you want.  The bill was $24 before tax and tip. Pricey for what you got.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot in Gastonia
data.text: I have only been twice to Spindle City but I have thoroughly enjoyed my visits. The menu is ever-evolving to incorporate fresh and seasonal ingredients. The menu also includes family recipes, which is a nice touch. Service is excellent and so friendly. I would eat here every day if I could! Love it.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: My wife and I had lunch at the Cafe recently. Outstanding service and friendly staff. Great food. The pumpkin soup was fantastic.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great chicken salad, but my wife had the grilled pimento cheese with bacon.  Mine was great, but her's was awesome. Potato salad was really good too.  Hate I don't work closer.

data.title: Best chicken salad anywhere
data.text: Great little place for a quick lunch. Everything is made in house.  Servings are just right size.  Housed in historic old, brick building, right on Main avenue.  As I said, do try the chicken salad.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Have eaten here many times and food and service is awesome. They also catered my daughters wedding and I cannot say enough wonderful things about not only the cafe but also the family. They are truly exceptional people and a blessing to our community.

data.title: Delicious and Local.
data.text: Every time I go to Spindle City, it is delicious. I usually get the chicken salad press on sourdough or the blackberry brie grilled cheese on sourdough. If I am with my Mom, we will each get one and split them so we can get a taste of both. It is easily the most DELICIOUS lunch in Gastonia. The staff is also great, everyone is very nice!

data.title: Delicious Warm Pressed Chicken Salad Sandwich.
data.text: After you have visited Gaston Pickers (which I highly recommend for antiquing), go to Spindle City Cafe for lunch. It's downtown, good parking in rear, and offers a variety of truly tasty sandwiches. I recommend the warm pressed chicken salad sandwich on rye. My friend raved over the bacon apple grilled cheese. Pricing is medium range.

data.title: Come Early or You'll Miss Out on the Fresh Baked Cake
data.text: Got the last slice of Sundrop Cake...just barely! It was delicious and so was my hotdog. Brought my friend Sandy for a girl's Day Out and we have a great time! Stopped by a local antique shop down the street after lunch!

data.title: Great, freshly prepared food
data.text: Had a business lunch here this week. The food was excellent. Everything was delicious and freshly prepared. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

data.title: Easy, tasty quick lunch in town.  Nice experience!
data.text:
This little lunch cafe has a great Tomato Basil soup (homemade).  I've ordered on two different occasions (in the month of July) and both lunch sandwiches were tasty.  I ordered the Reuben Press (with the soup) and also the Steak sandwich wrap.  All the menu items were tasty and homemade.  It was a quick easy lunch (during court house work) and it was also timely.

The staff is attentive and courteous of their customers.  The portions were just the right size.  As a trade off, the prices were a little on the high side ($7.50 for the Reuben and soup), but it was homemade.  I also have to say the the corned beef was not sliced thin.  It was sort of chunked up and very tender.  So, have really great corned beef offsets the prices of the meal.

data.title: Atmosphere, good food to boot.
data.text: I attended a catered event at this chic café recently. The food was better than average. While I was waiting to get my succulent chicken in cream sauce, I perused the lunch menu. I can only say that I shall return. The "sweet" tea was a little saddening, and it was a little warm inside, but the food and the atmosphere overcame my minuscule complaints.
